description: Store & query data items via AWS web services requests.

blocks.name: listDomains
blocks.description: This endpoint returns domain names up to the limit set by MaxNumberOfDomains. A NextToken is returned if there are more than MaxNumberOfDomains domains.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: The region for endpoint. See README for all possible values.

args.name: maxNumberOfDomains
args.info: The maximum number of domain names you want returned. The range is 1 to 100. The default setting is 100.

args.name: nextToken
args.info: String that tells Amazon SimpleDB where to start the next list of domain names.

blocks.name: createDomain
blocks.description: This endpoint allows to creates a new domain. The domain name must be unique among the domains associated with the apiKey provided in the request. The CreateDomain operation might take 10 or more seconds to complete.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: The region for endpoint. See README for all possible values.

args.name: domainName
args.info: The name of the domain to create. The name can range between 3 and 255 characters and can contain the following characters: a-z, A-Z, 0-9, '_', '-', and '.'.

blocks.name: deleteDomain
blocks.description: This endpoint allows to deletes a domain. Any items (and their attributes) in the domain are deleted as well. The DeleteDomain operation might take 10 or more seconds to complete.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: The region for endpoint. See README for all possible values.

args.name: domainName
args.info: The name of the domain to delete.

blocks.name: getAttributes
blocks.description: Returns all of the attributes associated with the item. Optionally, the attributes returned can be limited to one or more specified attribute name parameters.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: The region for endpoint. See README for all possible values.

args.name: itemName
args.info: The name of the item.

args.name: attributeName
args.info: The name of the attribute.

args.name: domainName
args.info: The name of the domain in which to perform the operation.

args.name: consistentRead
args.info: When set to true, ensures that the most recent data is returned. Default: false.

blocks.name: putAttributes
blocks.description: This endpoint allows to creates or replaces attributes in an item.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: The region for endpoint. See README for all possible values.

args.name: itemName
args.info: The name of the item.

args.name: domainName
args.info: The name of the domain in which to perform the operation.

args.name: attributes
args.info: Array of objects. Attributes are uniquely identified in an item by their name/value combination. Attribute.X.Name and Attribute.X.Value are reuired. See README for more details.

args.name: expectedName
args.info: Name of the attribute to check. Must be used with the expected value or expected exists parameter.

args.name: expectedValue
args.info: Value of the attribute to check. Must be used with the expected name parameter. Can be used with the expected exists parameter if that parameter is set to true.

args.name: expectedExists
args.info: Flag to test the existence of an attribute while performing conditional updates. Must be used with the expected name parameter. When set to true, this must be used with the expected value parameter. When set to false, this cannot be used with the expected value parameter.

blocks.name: deleteAttributes
blocks.description: This endpoint allows to deletes one or more attributes associated with the item. If all attributes of an item are deleted, the item is deleted.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: The region for endpoint. See README for all possible values.

args.name: itemName
args.info: The name of the item.

args.name: domainName
args.info: The name of the domain in which to perform the operation.

args.name: attributes
args.info: Array of objects. Attributes are uniquely identified in an item by their name/value combination. If you specify DeleteAttributes without attribute names or values, all the attributes for the item are deleted. See README for more details.

args.name: expectedName
args.info: Name of the attribute to check. Must be used with the expected value or expected exists parameter.

args.name: expectedValue
args.info: Value of the attribute to check. Must be used with the expected name parameter. Can be used with the expected exists parameter if that parameter is set to true.

args.name: expectedExists
args.info: Flag to test the existence of an attribute while performing conditional updates. Must be used with the expected name parameter. When set to true, this must be used with the expected value parameter. When set to false, this cannot be used with the expected value parameter.

blocks.name: batchPutAttributes
blocks.description: With the BatchPutAttributes operation, you can perform multiple PutAttribute operations in a single call. This helps you yield savings in round trips and latencies, and enables Amazon SimpleDB to optimize requests, which generally yields better throughput.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: The region for endpoint. See README for all possible values.

args.name: domainName
args.info: The name of the domain in which to perform the operation.

args.name: items
args.info: Array of objects. Items of attributes are uniquely identified in an item by their name/value combination. See README for more details.

blocks.name: batchDeleteAttributes
blocks.description: Performs multiple DeleteAttributes operations in a single call, which reduces round trips and latencies. This enables Amazon SimpleDB to optimize requests, which generally yields better throughput.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: The region for endpoint. See README for all possible values.

args.name: domainName
args.info: The name of the domain in which to perform the operation.

args.name: items
args.info: Array of objects. Items to be deleted. See README for more details.

blocks.name: domainMetadata
blocks.description: Returns information about the domain, including when the domain was created, the number of items and attributes, and the size of attribute names and values.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: The region for endpoint. See README for all possible values.

args.name: domainName
args.info: The name of the domain for which to display metadata.

blocks.name: makeSelectExpression
blocks.description: The Select operation returns a set of Attributes for ItemNames that match the select expression. Select is similar to the standard SQL SELECT statement.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: The region for endpoint. See README for all possible values.

args.name: selectExpression
args.info: The expression used to query the domain. For example: select Color from `MyDomain` where Color like '%Blue%'.

args.name: consistentRead
args.info: true or false. When set to true, ensures that the most recent data is returned.

args.name: nextToken
args.info: String that tells Amazon SimpleDB where to start the next list of ItemNames.
